Born in [[Gelsenkirchen]], Gündoğan came through [[VfL Bochum]]'s youth academy. In 2008, he began playing for the club's [[VfL Bochum II|reserve side]] before joining [[1. FC Nürnberg]] the following season. He was then acquired by [[Borussia Dortmund]] in 2011, winning the double of [[Bundesliga]] and [[DFB-Pokal]] in his first season. In 2013, he helped ''die Borussen'' reach their first [[List of European Cup and UEFA Champions League finals|UEFA Champions League Final]] since 1996–97. After playing a total of 157 matches and scoring 15 goals for the club, Gündoğan signed for Manchester City for an estimated transfer fee of £21 million in the summer of 2016. He won the Premier League and [[EFL Cup]] in 2017–18.
Gündoğan made his senior debut for Germany in 2011 after previously being [[Cap (sport)|capped]] by Germany youth teams at [[Germany national under-18 football team|under-18]], [[Germany national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[Germany national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[Germany national under-21 football team|under-21]] levels. He was chosen in Germany's squads for [[UEFA Euro 2012]] and the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Early career=== Gündoğan was born in [[Gelsenkirchen]] to [[Turks in Germany|Turkish parents]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/news/newsid=1803642.html | title = İlkay Gündoğan | publisher = UEFA.com | date = 25 May 2012 | accessdate = 1 November 2012}}</ref> His grandfather moved from [[Balıkesir]], Turkey, to the [[Ruhrgebiet|Ruhr region]] of Germany.<ref>{{Citation | last=Kramer|first=Jörg | title=Der Kurzpassmeister | publisher=Spiegel-Verlag Rudolf Augstein GmbH & Co. KG (Ove Saffe) | publication-place=Hamburg | number=21 | year=2013 | pages=126–128 | url = http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/d-95169332.html | accessdate=27 January 2015|language=de}}</ref> Gündoğan moved from [[VfL Bochum]] to [[1. FC Nürnberg]] in 2009. In his fourth Bundesliga match, on 19 September 2009, away against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]], he made his first [[Assist (football)|assist]]. His first goal for the side came on 20 February 2010 in a home match, again against Bayern Munich.
===Borussia Dortmund=== [[File:Ilkay Gündogan 2013 in Wilhelmshaven.jpeg|thumb|left|upright|Gündoğan in action for [[Borussia Dortmund]] in 2013]] On 5 May 2011, it was announced Gündoğan had signed a four-year contract with [[Borussia Dortmund]] for an approximate transfer fee of €4 million.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.goal.com/en/news/11/transfer-zone/2011/05/05/2472669/borussia-dortmund-announce-signing-of-nurnbergs-ilkay|title=Borussia Dortmund announce signing of Nurnberg's Ilkay Gundogan|work=goal.com| date=5 May 2011 | accessdate = 12 June 2013}}</ref> He made his debut on 23 July in the [[DFL-Supercup]] against [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]]. After a goalless draw at the [[Veltins-Arena]], he scored their first attempt in the [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]], although [[Kevin Großkreutz]] and [[Ivan Perišić]] missed to hand Schalke the victory.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fährmann bringt BVB zur Verzweiflung|trans-title=Fährmann brings BVB to despair |url=http://www.kicker.de/d-supercup-fb-1/2011/1/1139370/spielbericht_borussia-dortmund-17_fc-schalke-04-2.html|accessdate=27 April 2015|work=Kicker|date=23 July 2011|language=German}}</ref>
On 17 December, Gündoğan scored his first goal for Dortmund in a 4–1 victory away to [[SC Freiburg]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Kotsev|first1=Vasil|title=Freiburg 1–4 Borussia Dortmund: Jurgen Klopp's men record emphatic win to close gap on Bayern Munich|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/match/freiburg-vs-borussia-dortmund/1122093/report?ICID=MP_MS_5|accessdate=27 April 2015|work=Goal.com|date=17 December 2011}}</ref> He played once for the [[Borussia Dortmund II|club's reserves]] on 22 February 2012, being replaced at half time by [[Rico Benatelli]] in an eventual 2–1 win over [[1. FC Kaiserslautern II]] at the [[Stadion Rote Erde]].<ref>{{cite web|title=BORUSSIA DORTMUND II VS. KAISERSLAUTERN II 2 – 1|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/02/22/germany/regionalliga/borussia-dortmund-ii/1-fc-kaiserslautern-ii/1138925/|publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=27 April 2015}}</ref> On 20 March, Gündoğan scored a 120th-minute goal to defeat [[SpVgg Greuther Fürth|Greuther Fürth]] and send Dortmund into the final of the [[2011–12 DFB-Pokal|DFB-Pokal]].<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2012/3/20/2888404/borussia-dortmund-vs-spvgg-greuther-furth-2012-dfb-pokal-final-score-report | title = SpVgg Greuther Fürth Vs. Borussia Dortmund, 2012 DFB-Pokal: Der BVB Through With Winner At The Death | publisher = sbnation.com | date = 20 March 2012 | accessdate = 24 June 2012 | first = Kevin | last = McCauley}}</ref> He played the entire [[2012 DFB-Pokal Final|final]] on 12 May, a 5–2 victory over Bayern Munich which gave Dortmund their first domestic [[Double (association football)|double]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Webber|first1=Tom|title=Borussia Dortmund 5–2 Bayern Munich: Lewandowski hat-trick secures domestic double for Jurgen Klopp's men|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/borussia-dortmund-vs-bayern-m%C3%BCnchen/1275349/report|accessdate=27 April 2015|work=Goal.com|date=12 May 2012}}</ref>
In the [[2012–13 Borussia Dortmund season|2012–13 season]], Gündoğan was one of the central figures of Borussia Dortmund as they reached the final of [[UEFA Champions League]]. He was praised for his play in two semi-final games against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.goal.com/en/match/106422/borussia-dortmund-vs-real-madrid-cf/player-ratings | title = Player Ratings: Dortmund 4–1 Real Madrid | publisher = goal.com | date = 24 April 2013 | accessdate = 12 June 2013 | first = Robin | last = Bairner}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.goal.com/en/match/106423/real-madrid-cf-vs-borussia-dortmund/player-ratings | title = Player Ratings: Real Madrid 2–0 Borussia Dortmund (Agg 3–4) | publisher = goal.com | date = 30 April 2013 | accessdate = 12 June 2013 | first = Tom | last = Webber}}</ref> On 25 May 2013, he scored the equaliser from the penalty spot in the 69th minute to keep Dortmund's hopes alive against Bayern Munich in the [[2013 UEFA Champions League Final]] played at [[Wembley Stadium]], [[London]]. This was his first penalty kick in a game for Dortmund. Bayern Munich went on to win the match 2–1.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.goal.com/en/match/107889/borussia-dortmund-vs-fc-bayern-m%C3%BCnchen/player-ratings | title = Player Ratings: Borussia Dortmund 1–2 Bayern Munich | publisher = goal.com | date = 25 May 2013 | accessdate = 12 June 2013 | first = Rafael | last = Corradino }}</ref>
On 27 July 2013, Gündoğan scored a goal when he won the [[2013 DFL-Supercup]] with Dortmund 4–2 against rivals Bayern Munich.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/tournaments/news/2013/0000262446.php|title=Dortmund prevail over Bayern in Supercup thriller | publisher = bundesliga.com | date = 27 July 2013 | accessdate = 23 December 2013}}</ref> In August, a back injury while on international duty required surgery, which eventually ruled him out for a full year.<ref name=back/> In April 2014, he signed a new contract, to keep him at the club until 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=GÜNDOGAN COMMITS FUTURE TO DORTMUND|url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/liga/news/2013/0000291507.php|accessdate=27 April 2015|publisher=Bundesliga|date=15 April 2014}}</ref>
On 28 April 2015, Gündoğan and [[Sebastian Kehl]] scored in a [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] victory over Bayern Munich which sent Dortmund into the [[2015 DFB-Pokal Final|DFB-Pokal Final]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Bayern Mun 1–1 Bor Dortmd|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32484226|accessdate=29 April 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=28 April 2015}}</ref> Two days later, it was announced he and Borussia Dortmund would not be extending their contract after it expired after 30 July 2016.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ilkay Gundogan: Borussia Dortmund midfielder will leave club|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32537619|accessdate=30 April 2015|date=30 April 2015}}</ref> However, on 1 July 2015, he signed a contract extension to keep him at the club until 2017.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ilkay Gundogan signs extension, commits to Dortmund until 2017|url=http://www.espnfc.com/borussia-dortmund/story/2510044/ilkay-gundogan-signs-borussia-dortmund-contract-extension|accessdate=1 July 2015|date=1 July 2015}}</ref>
===Manchester City=== {{wikinews|Gündogan signs with Manchester City}} On 2 June 2016, Gündoğan signed a four-year contract with [[Premier League]] side [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], for an estimated fee of £20 million. He was the club's first signing under former Bayern Munich manager [[Pep Guardiola]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ornstein|first1=David|title=Ilkay Gundogan: Man City sign midfielder from Borussia Dortmund|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36430721|accessdate=2 June 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 June 2016}}</ref> He made his debut on 14 September, playing for the first time in four months in a [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League group stage|UEFA Champions League]] group stage game at home to [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]]. City won 4–0, and he won a penalty which was converted by [[Sergio Agüero]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Manchester City 4–0 B M'gladbach|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37331231|accessdate=17 September 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 September 2016}}</ref> Three days later, Gündoğan started and scored with a low, right-foot shot against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] in a 4–0 win at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Manchester City 4–0 Bournemouth|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37325835|accessdate= 17 September 2016|publisher= BBC Sport|date=17 September 2016}}</ref> He scored a brace and set up an Agüero goal against [[West Bromwich Albion]] in a 4–0 win at [[The Hawthorns]] on 29 October 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title = West Bromwich Albion 0–4 Manchester City|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37737767|accessdate= 30 October 2016|publisher= BBC Sport|date= 29 October 2016}}</ref> He continued his run of form by scoring twice against [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in a 3–1 win at home in the group stages of the Champions League.<ref>{{cite news|title = Ilkay Gundogan scores brace, motors Man City midfield to win vs. Barcelona|url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/manchester-city/382/blog/post/2986393/manchester-city-barcelona-ilkay-gundogan-scores-brace-motors-midfield-to-win|accessdate= 2 November 2016|publisher= ESPN|date= 2 November 2016}}</ref>
On 14 December, in a [[2016–17 Premier League|Premier League]] match against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], Gündoğan was substituted in the 44th minute with knee ligament damage, with Guardiola stating he would be out injured for several months.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manchester City midfielder facing injury lay-off|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38324586|accessdate=15 December 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 December 2016}}</ref> It was later confirmed Gündoğan tore his cruciate ligaments in his right knee and would miss the remainder of [[2016–17 Manchester City F.C. season|the season]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Jackson|first1=Jamie|title=Manchester City’s Ilkay Gündogan set to miss rest of season with cruciate injury|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/dec/16/manchester-city-ilkay-gundogan-ruled-out-season-cruciate-injury-knee|website=The Guardian|date=16 December 2016| access-date = 16 December 2016}}</ref>
On 16 September 2017, Gündoğan made his first appearance for Manchester City in nine months, appearing as a substitute in the team's 6–0 [[2017–18 Premier League|Premier League]] win at Watford.<ref>{{Cite web | url = http://au.eurosport.com/football/premier-league/2017-2018/watford-v-manchester-city-live_sto6334336/story.shtml | title = Manchester City hit six against Watford to go top | website = Eurosport | date = 16 September 2017 | access-date = 17 September 2017 | first = Alexander | last = Netherton}}</ref> Three months later, he scored his first goal of the season with a header, assisted by [[Leroy Sané]], which gave City the lead in a 4–1 win against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/match-report/2017/december/manchester-city-v-spurs-premier-league-december-16-match-report|title=City v Spurs: Match report|website=MCFC |access-date=17 December 2017}}</ref> He scored a brace, one in each half, as City routed [[FC Basel]] in the away leg of their round of sixteen tie in the Champions League.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=499538|title=Gundogan scores two as Man City thrash Basel in round of 16 |access-date=15 February 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:FIFA WC-qualification 2014 - Austria vs. Germany 2012-09-11 - İlkay Gündoğan 03.JPG|thumb|Gündoğan warming up for [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in September 2012]] After years of playing for the different youth teams, Gündoğan received his first call-up to the [[Germany national football team|Germany senior team]] in August 2011 for a [[friendly match]] against [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]], but did not feature in the game. On 11 October, he made his debut for Germany after coming on as a substitute for captain [[Philipp Lahm]] for the last six minutes of the 3–1 win against [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]] in a [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying]] match at the [[Esprit Arena]], [[Düsseldorf]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Germany stamp out Belgium's fire|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002112/postmatch/report/index.html|accessdate=26 April 2015|publisher=UEFA|date=11 October 2011}}</ref>
In May 2012, he was selected by manager [[Joachim Löw]] for the German 23-man squad for [[UEFA Euro 2012]] and was given the number two shirt. Germany reached the semi-finals, but Gündoğan did not feature.
On 26 March 2013, Gündoğan scored his first goal for Germany in a 4–1 [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualifying|2014 FIFA World Cup qualifier]] against [[Kazakhstan national football team|Kazakhstan]] at the [[Frankenstadion]], [[Nuremberg]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Dortmund-fired Germany too good for Kazakhstan|url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/season=2014/matches/round=2000294/match=2008586/postmatch/report/index.html|accessdate=26 April 2015|publisher=UEFA|date=26 March 2013}}</ref> He scored his second goal in his next match, a friendly on 14 August at the [[Fritz-Walter-Stadion]], [[Kaiserslautern]], as Germany came from 0–2 down to draw 3–3 against [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Germany came from 2–0 down to down 3–3 with Paraguay in Kaiserslautern|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/283619/report|accessdate=26 April 2015|work=Sky Sports|date=14 August 2013}}</ref> However, he was taken off with a back injury in this match, ruling him out for an entire year, meaning he would miss the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014 World Cup]], which Germany would go on to win.<ref name=back>{{cite news|title=GÜNDOGAN DELIGHTED TO RETURN TO DORTMUND TRAINING|url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/liga/news/2014/0000299560.php|accessdate=27 April 2015|publisher=Bundesliga|date=18 August 2014}}</ref>
Gündoğan returned to international football in a 2–2 friendly with [[Australia national soccer team|Australia]] on 25 March 2015.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.com.au/international-friendly/story/2372817/ilkay-gundogan-recovering-from-back-injury-like-a-personal-accolade|title=Ilkay Gundogan: Recovering from back injury like a personal accolade|date=30 March 2015|work=ESPN | access-date = 7 May 2016 | first = Stephan | last = Uersfeld}}</ref> He participated in the [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualification|Euro 2016]] campaign, scoring in a 7–0 away win over [[Gibraltar national football team|Gibraltar]] on 14 June 2015<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33122742|title=Armenia 2–3 Portugal|date=14 June 2015|work=BBC | access-date = 7 May 2016}}</ref> and a 3–2 win against [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] at [[Hampden Park]] on 7 September 2015.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/34063135|title=Scotland 2–3 Germany|date=7 September 2015|work=BBC | access-date = 7 May 2016 | first = Alasdair | last = Lamont}}</ref>
On 6 May 2016, it was announced Gündoğan would be unable to participate at the [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016 final stages]] due to injury.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36229512|title=Euro 2016: Germany's Ilkay Gundogan set to miss tournament with knee injury|date=6 May 2016|work=BBC | access-date = 7 May 2016}}</ref> He did, however, make the team's preliminary squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup in Russia]] which was announced in May 2018.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/wm/wmteams/weltmeisterschaft/2018/deutschland/kader.html | title = Deutschland – Weltmeisterschaft: der Kader der Saison 2018 | website = kicker.de | access-date = 2 June 2018}}</ref> On 4 June 2018, Gündoğan was selected in Joachim Löw's final 23-man squad for the World Cup.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dw.com/en/germany-announce-final-world-cup-squad-with-manuel-neuer-without-leroy-san%C3%A9/a-44064011|title=Germany announce final World Cup squad, with Manuel Neuer, without Leroy Sané|publisher=Deutsche Welle|accessdate=4 June 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== [[Jürgen Klopp]], Gündoğan's former coach at Borussia Dortmund, described Gündoğan as an "intelligent and complete midfielder with numerous strengths".<ref name=wright>{{cite web|last1=Wright|first1=Nick|title=Ilkay Gundogan: We profile the Manchester United target|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/21476/9821981/ilkay-gundogan-we-profile-the-midfielder-wanted-by-manchester-united|website=Sky Sports|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=27 April 2015}}</ref> Although Gündoğan had a tough start at Dortmund, where he admitted "things hadn't gone as well as I had thought", his "willingness to learn" and "great attitude", according to Klopp, have allowed him to play a pivotal role in his later career at the club.<ref name=wright/> He was able to fit into Dortmund's explosive playing style "by combining creativity and outstanding passing with the defensive attributes and tireless energy needed".<ref name=wright/>
==Personal life== Gündoğan's cousin [[Naz Aydemir]] is a [[volleyball]] player for [[Vakıfbank Spor Kulübü|Vakıfbank]] and the [[Turkey women's national volleyball team|Turkish women's national team]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/liga/news/2012/0000257728.php|title=Ten things about Ilkay Gündogan|work=[[Bundesliga|bundesliga.com]]| date=19 June 2013 | accessdate=27 August 2013}}</ref>
In May 2018, Gündoğan met [[President of Turkey]] [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] in London, along with [[Mesut Özil]] and [[Cenk Tosun]], two other English-based, German-born players of Turkish origin. Gündoğan was criticised for referring to the statesman as "my president", despite only being a citizen of Germany. The incident caused political controversy in Germany and Gündoğan was jeered by German fans when playing for the national team weeks later.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ilkay Gundogan, Mesut Ozil whistles must stop – Germany chief Oliver Bierhoff |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/germany/story/3520068/ilkay-gundogan-and-mesut-ozil-whistles-must-stop-germany-chief-oliver-bierhoff |accessdate=9 June 2018 |publisher=ESPN FC |date=8 June 2018}}</ref>
